title: NDP 2026: Rehearsal Night Chaos
description: It's the combined rehearsal and 40,000 people just opened the app at once. The servers are screaming. Your team has to keep things running while the show goes on.

software-engineer.title: Emergency Performance Fix
software-engineer.instruction: The app is crawling. Response times hit 8 seconds and people are closing the app in frustration. You've identified three bottlenecks but only have time to fix one before the fireworks segment. Which do you tackle?

options.label: Add an aggressive caching layer so repeated requests for float data don't hit the database. Fixes 60% of the load but some users might see stale fun facts for a few minutes.
Temporarily disable the AR overlay and serve a simplified text only version. Kills the wow factor but the app becomes instantly responsive.
Rewrite the slowest database queries to use better indexing. Takes longer to implement but fixes the root cause permanently.
Implement a request queue so users see a brief loading animation instead of timeouts. Nobody gets instant results but nobody gets errors either.

data-scientist.title: Diagnose the Traffic Spike
data-scientist.instruction: The monitoring dashboard is lit up like a Christmas tree. You need to run a proper incident analysis to figure out what's actually failing and why. Put these diagnostic steps in the right order.

items.label: Pull up the real time metrics dashboard to see CPU, memory, and network usage
Correlate the spike timing with specific API endpoints to find the bottleneck
Sample error logs from the last 10 minutes to spot patterns in failures
Run distributed tracing on slow requests to see where time is being spent
Write up findings with data visualisations so the team can act on them

cloud-engineer.title: Scale the Servers
cloud-engineer.instruction: Current setup has 4 server instances handling about 10,000 users each. But 40,000 users just showed up and more are joining. Based on the user count over the last 4 time windows (in thousands), predict how many server instances you need to spin up RIGHT NOW to handle the peak.
